LongitudinalBunchMethod: sigma s, sigma dp, dp s coupling
sigma s, sigma dp, alpha z
emit z, beta z, alpha z

String

String

String

String

name: Name
String
dt: maximum time duration of wake (0 for autoscale)
tmax: maximum time duration of wake (0 for autoscale)
n_bins: number of bins for charge histogram (0 for autoscale)
smoothing: Use Savitzky-Golay filter to smooth current histogram?
allow_long_beam: allow beam longer than wake data?
ramp_passes: Number of passes over which to linearly ramp up the wake to full strength.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
etilt: error rotation about incoming longitudinal axis
edge_order: order to which to include edge effects
edge1_kick_limit: maximum kick entrance edge can deliver
edge2_kick_limit: maximum kick exit edge can deliver
kick_limit_scaling: scale maximum edge kick with FSE?
b1: K1 = b1/rho, where rho is bend radius
xreference: reference x for interpretation of fn values
f1: Fractional field error fn=bn*xr^n/n!, adds to K1 or b1.
f2: Fractional field error fn=bn*xr^n/n!, adds to K2 or b2.
isr1part: Include ISR for single-particle beam only if ISR=1 and ISR1PART=1
sqrt_order: Order of expansion of square-root in Hamiltonian. 0 means no expansion.
use_rad_dist: If nonzero, overrides SYNCH RAD and ISR, causing simulation of radiation from distributions, optionally including opening angle.
add_opening_angle: If nonzero, radiation opening angle effects are add if USE RAD DIST is nonzero.
reference_correction: If nonzero, reference trajectory is subtracted from particle trajectories to compensate for inaccuracy in integration.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
etilt: error rotation about incoming longitudinal axis
linearize: use linear matrix instead of symplectic integrator?
edge_order: order to which to include edge effects
bins: number of bins for CSR wake
bin_once: bin only at the start of the dipole?
bin_range_factor: Factor by which to increase the range of histogram compared to total bunch length. Large value eliminates binning problems in CSRDRIFTs.
sg_halfwidth: Savitzky-Golay filter half-width for smoothing current histogram. If less than 1, no SG smoothing is performed.
sg_order: Savitzky-Golay filter order for smoothing current histogram
sgderiv_halfwidth: Savitzky-Golay filter half-width for taking derivative of current histogram. Defaults to SG HALFWIDTH (if positive) or else 1.
sgderiv_order: Savitzky-Golay filter order for taking derivative of current histogram
trapazoid_integration: Select whether to use trapazoid-rule integration (default)or a simple sum.
output_interval: interval (in kicks) of output to OUTPUT FILE
igf: use integrated Greens function (requires STEADY STATE=1)?
b1: K1 = b1/rho, where rho is bend radius
isr1part: Include ISR for single-particle beam only if ISR=1 and ISR1PART=1
particle_output_file: name of file for phase-space output
particle_output_interval: interval (in kicks) of output to PARTICLE OUTPUT FILE
slice_analysis_interval: interval (in kicks) of output to slice analysis file (from slice analysis command)
low_frequency_cutoff0: Highest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is zero. If not positive, no low-frequency cutoff filter is applied. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
low_frequency_cutoff1: Lowest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is 1. If not given, defaults to LOW FREQUENCY CUTOFF1.
high_frequency_cutoff0: Spatial frequency at which smoothing (high-frequency cutoff) filter begins. If not positive, no frequency filter smoothing is done. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
high_frequency_cutoff1: Spatial frequency at which smoothing (high-frequency cutoff) filter is 0. If not given, defaults to HIGH FREQUENCY CUTOFF0.
clip_negative_bins: If non-zero, then any bins with negative counts after the filters are applied have the counts set to zero.
wake_filter_file: Name of file supplying wake-field filtering data.
wff_freq_column: Name of column supplying frequency values for wakefield filtering data.
wff_real_column: Name of column supplying real values for wakefield filtering data.
wff_imag_column: Name of column supplying imaginary values for wakefield filtering data.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
n_kicks: number of kicks (if DZ is zero)
use_overtaking_length: use overtaking length for ATTENUATION LENGTH?
ol_multiplier: factor by which to multiply the overtaking length to get the attenuation length
use_saldin54: Use Saldin et al eq. 54 (NIM A398(1997)373-394 for decay vs z?
saldin54points: Number of values of position inside bunch to average for Saldin eq 54.
saldin54_output: Filename for output of CSR intensity vs. z as computed using Saldin eq 54.
use_stupakov: Use treatment from G. Stupakov's note of 9/12/2001?
stupakov_output: Filename for output of CSR wake vs. s as computed using Stupakov's equations.
stupakov_output_interval: Interval (in kicks) between output of Stupakov wakes.
slice_analysis_interval: interval (in kicks) of output to slice analysis file (from slice analysis command)
linearize: use linear optics for drift pieces?
lsc_bins: If non-zero, include LSC with given number of bins.
lsc_low_frequency_cutoff0: Highest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is zero. If not positive, no low-frequency cutoff filter is applied. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
lsc_low_frequency_cutoff1: Lowest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is 1. If not given, defaults to LOW FREQUENCY CUTOFF1.
lsc_high_frequency_cutoff0: Spatial frequency at which smoothing filter begins for LSC. If not positive, no frequency filter smoothing is done. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
lsc_high_frequency_cutoff1: Spatial frequency at which smoothing filter is 0 for LSC. If not given, defaults to HIGH FREQUENCY CUTOFF0.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

String
bx_max: Maximum on-axis magnetic field. Ignored if B MAX is nonzero.
by_max: Maximum on-axis magnetic field. Ignored if B MAX is nonzero.
by_file: Name of SDDS file with By harmonic data.
bx_file: Name of SDDS file with Bx harmonic data.
isr1part: Include ISR for single-particle beam only if ISR=1 and ISR1PART=1
sinusoidal: Ideal sinusoidal wiggler? If non-zero, BX FILE and BY FILE are not used.
vertical: If SINUSOIDAL is non-zero, then setting this to non-zero gives a vertical wiggler. Default is horizontal.
helical: Ideal helical wiggler? If non-zero and SINUSOIDAL is also non-zero, BX FILE and BY FILE are not used.
force_matched: Force matched dispersion for first harmonics? If non-zero, start and end of magnetic field will be inset from the ends of the device if phase is not 0 or Ï.
field_output: Name of file to which field samples will be written. Slow, so use only for debugging.
verbosity: A higher value requires more detailed printouts related to computations.

randomsign: If non-zero, then the scatter is given a random sign. Useful if distribution data is one-sided.
limitperpass: Maximum number of particles that will be scattered on each pass.
limittotal: Maximum number of particles that will be scatter for each step.
endonpass: Pass number to end on (inclusive). Ignored if negative.

String

phase_4: Longitudinal phase of the fourth row (bottom right)

String

energy_straggle: Use simple-minded energy straggling model coupled with ENERGY DECAY=1?
nuclear_bremsstrahlung: Model energy loss to nuclear bremsstrahlung? If enabled, set ENERGY DECAY=0 to disable simpler model.

String

file2dl: filename for 2d dt-deltaP histogram output, possibly incomplete (see below)
file4d: filename for 4d x-x'-y-y' histogram output, possibly incomplete (see below)
file6d: filename for 6d x-x'-y-y'-dtdeltaP histogram output, possibly incomplete (see below)
input_bins: Name ofSDDSfile contains input bin number.
normalize: normalize histogram with number of particles?
disable: If nonzero, no output will be generated.
lumped: If nonzero, then results at elements with same name will be output to a single multipage SDDS file.

name: Name
String
q: cavity Q (for cavity that charges up to given voltage from 0)
phase_reference: phase reference number (to link with other time-dependent elements)
change_t: set to 1 for long runs to avoid rounding error in phase
fiducial: mode for determining fiducial arrival time
body_focus_model: None or SRS (simplified Rosenzweig/Serafini for standing wave)
n_kicks: Number of kicks to use for kick method. Set to zero for matrix method.
lock_phase: Lock phase to given value regardless of bunch centroid motion?
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
cell_length: cell length (used to scale wakes, which are assumed to be given for a cell, according to L/CELL LENGTH)
q: cavity Q (for cavity that charges up to voltage from 0)
phase_reference: phase reference number (to link with other time-dependent elements)
fiducial: mode for determining fiducial arrival time
body_focus_model: None or SRS (simplified Rosenzweig/Serafini for standing wave)
n_kicks: Number of kicks to use for kick method. Set to zero for matrix method.
zwake: If zero, longitudinal wake is turned off.
trwake: If zero, transverse wakes are turned off.
wakefile: name of file containing Green functions
zwakefile: if WAKEFILE=NULL, optional name of file containing longitudinal Green function
trwakefile: if WAKEFILE=NULL, optional name of file containing transverse Green functions
n_bins: number of bins for current histogram
smoothing: Use Savitzky-Golay filter to smooth current histogram?
lsc_bins: Number of bins for LSC calculations
lsc_low_frequency_cutoff0: Highest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is zero. If not positive, no low-frequency cutoff filter is applied. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
lsc_low_frequency_cutoff1: Lowest spatial frequency at which low-frequency cutoff filter is 1. If not given, defaults to LOW FREQUENCY CUTOFF1.
lsc_high_frequency_cutoff0: Spatial frequency at which smoothing filter begins for LSC. If not positive, no frequency filter smoothing is done. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
lsc_high_frequency_cutoff1: Spatial frequency at which smoothing filter is 0 for LSC. If not given, defaults to HIGH FREQUENCY CUTOFF0.
wakes_at_end: Do wake kicks at end of segment (for backward compatibility)?
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
phase_reference: phase reference number (to link with other time-dependent elements)
standing_wave: If nonzero, then cavity is standing wave.
voltage_waveform: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving voltage waveform factor vs time
voltage_periodic: If non-zero, voltage waveform is periodic with period given by time span.
align_waveforms: If non-zero, waveforms' t=0 is aligned with first bunch arrival time.
voltage_noise: Rms fractional noise level for voltage.
group_voltage_noise: Rms fractional noise level for voltage linked to group.
group_phase_noise: Rms noise level for phase linked to group.
start_pass: If non-negative, pass on which to start modeling cavity.
end_pass: If non-negative, pass on which to end modeling cavity.
drift_matrix: If non-zero, calculations involving matrices assume this element is a drift space.
magnetic_deflection: If non-zero, deflection is assumed to be performed by a magnetic field, rather than electric field (default).
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
freq: Resonant frequency of the cavity mode
initial_t: time at which INITIAL V and INITIAL PHASE held
bin_size: bin size for current histogram (use 0 for autosize)
n_bins: number of bins for current histogram
interpolate: if non-zero, interpolate voltage within bins
preload_charge: beam charge used for preloading calculations
preload_factor: multiply preloaded field by this value
preload_harmonic: If detuning from harmonic is greater than half the revolution frequency, automatic determination of the rf harmonic will fail. Give the harmonic explicitly with this parameter.
rigid_until_pass: don't affect the beam until this pass
detuned_until_pass: cavity is completely detuned until this pass
sample_interval: passes between samples to RECORD file
flush_interval: samples between flushing output to RECORD file
single_pass: if nonzero, don't accumulate field from pass to pass
pass_interval: interval in passes at which to apply PASS INTERVAL times the field (may increase speed)
freq_waveform: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving frequency/f0 vs time, where f0 is the frequency given with the FREQ parameter
q_waveform: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving qualityFactor/Q0 vs time, where Q0 is the quality factor given the the Q parameter.
ramp_passes: Number of passes over which to linearly ramp up the impedance to full strength.
binless: If nonzero, use algorithm that doesn't requiring binning. Best for few particles, widely spaced.
reset_for_each_step: If nonzero, voltage and phase are reset for each simulation step.
long_range_only: If nonzero, induced voltage from present turn does not affect bunch. Results are not self-consistent!
n_cavities: effect is multiplied by this number, simulating N identical cavities
bunched_beam_mode: If 1, then do calculations bunch-by-bunch. If >1, use pseudo bunches.
bunch_interval: For pseudo-bunch mode, time between bunches.
drive_frequency: drive frequency from generator. If zero, no generator voltage is applied.
update_interval: update interval of feedback in units of rf period
amplitude_filter: IIR filter specification for amplitude feedback
phase_filter: IIR filter specification for phase feedback
mute_generator: If nonnegative, gives the pass on which to mute the generator. This simulates an rf trip.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
phase_reference: phase reference number (to link with other time-dependent elements)
voltage_waveform: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving voltage waveform factor vs time
voltage_periodic: If non-zero, voltage waveform is periodic with period given by time span.
align_waveforms: If non-zero, waveforms' t=0 is aligned with first bunch arrival time.
voltage_noise: Rms fractional noise level for voltage.
group_voltage_noise: Rms fractional noise level for voltage linked to group.
group_phase_noise: Rms noise level for phase linked to group.
start_pass: If non-negative, pass on which to start modeling cavity.
end_pass: If non-negative, pass on which to end modeling cavity.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String

inputfile: file containing Ez vs z at r=0
solenoid_file: file containing map of Bz and Br vs z and r. Each page contains values for a single r.
solenoid_zcolumn: column containing z values for solenoid map.
solenoid_rcolumn: column containing r values for solenoid map. If omitted, data is assumed to be for r=0 and an on-axis expansion is performed.
solenoid_bzcolumn: column containing Bz values for solenoid map.
solenoid_brcolumn: column containing Br values for solenoid map. If omitted, data is assumed to be for r=0 and an on-axis expansion is performed.
solenoid_factor: factor by which to multiply solenoid fields.
field_test_file: filename for output of test fields (r=0)

String
probability: Probability that any particle will be selected for scattering.

String

name: Name
String
energy_decay: If nonzero, then particles will lose energy due to material using a simple exponential model.
energy_straggle: Use simple-minded energy straggling model coupled with ENERGY DECAY=1?
nuclear_bremsstrahlung: Model energy loss to nuclear bremsstrahlung? If enabled, set ENERGY DECAY=0 to disable simpler model.
electron_recoil: If non-zero, electron recoil during Coulomb scattering is included (results in energy change).
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
l: Length to be used for matrix-based operations such as twiss parameter computation.
command: SDDS-compliant command to apply to the beam. Use the sequence %i to represent the input filename and %o to represent the output filename.
use_csh: Use C-shell for execution (may be slower)?
start_pass: Start script action on this pass. Before that, behaves like a drift space.
end_pass: End script action after this pass. Before that, behaves like a drift space.
pass_interval: Execute script only even Nth pass following START PASS, including START PASS. Otherwise, behaves like a drift space.
on_pass: Perform script action only on this pass, overriding other pass controls. Other than that, behaves like a drift space.
directory: Directory in which to place input and output files. If blank, the present working directory is used.
rootname: Rootname for use in naming inputand output files. %s may be used to represent the run rootname.
input_extension: Extension for the script input file.
keep_files: If nonzero, then script input and output files are not deleted after use. By default, they are deleted.
drift_matrix: If nonzero, then for non-tracking calculations the element is treated as a drift space.
use_particle_id: If nonzero, then the output file will supply particle IDs. Otherwise, particles are renumbered.
no_new_particles: If nonzero, then no new particles will be added in the script output file.
np0: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np0
np1: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np1
np2: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np2
np3: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np3
np4: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np4
np5: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np5
np6: User-defined numerical parameter for command substitution for sequence %np6
sp9: User-defined string parameter for command substitution for sequence %sp9

String

String
b: field strength (used if KS is zero)

cutoff: cutoff (in sigmas) for gaussian random numbers
include_offsets: include orbit offsets in tracking (see below)?

name: Name
String
inputfile: name of file giving Green function
tcolumn: column in INPUTFILE containing time data
wcolumn: column in INPUTFILE containing Green function
n_bins: number of bins for current histogram
smoothing: Use Savitzky-Golay filter to smooth current histogram?
allow_long_beam: allow beam longer than wake data?

name: Name
String
fraction: fraction of particles to dump (coordinate mode)
start_pid: starting particleID for particles to dump
end_pid: ending particleID for particles to dump
end_pass: pass on which to end (inclusive). Ignored if negative.
label: LABEL
OptionalString
output label
x_data: include x data in coordinate mode?
y_data: include y data in coordinate mode?
longit_data: include longitudinal data in coordinate mode?
flush_interval: file flushing interval (parameter or centroid mode)
disable: If nonzero, no output will be generated.
use_disconnect: If nonzero, files are disconnected between each write operation. Maybe useful for parallel operation. Ignored otherwise.
index_offset: Offset for file indices for sequential file naming.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
radius: Peak bending radius. Ignored if K or B is non-negative.
b: Peak vertical magnetic field. Ignored if K is non-negative
focusing: If 0, turn off vertical focusing (this is unphysical!)
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
zreal: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving real part of impedance vs f (BROAD BAND=0)
zimag: <filename>=<x>+<y>form specification of input file giving imaginary part of impedance vs f (BROAD BAND=0)
bin_size: bin size for current histogram (use 0 for autosize)
n_bins: number of bins for current histogram
max_n_bins: Maximum number of bins for current histogram
wake_interval: interval in passes at which to output wake
wake_start: pass at which to start to output wake
wake_end: pass at which to stop to output wake
area_weight: use area-weighting in assigning charge to histogram?
smoothing: Use Savitzky-Golay filter to smooth current histogram?
reverse_time_order: Reverse time-order of particles for wake computation?
factor: Factor by which to multiply impedance.
start_on_pass: The pass on which the impedance effects start.
ramp_passes: Number of passes over which to linearly ramp up the impedance to full strength.
high_frequency_cutoff0: Frequency at which smoothing filter begins. If not positive, no frequency filter smoothing is done. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
high_frequency_cutoff1: Frequency at which smoothing filter is 0. If not given, defaults to HIGH FREQUENCY CUTOFF0.
bunched_beam_mode: If non-zero, then do calculations bunch-by-bunch.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

name: Name
String
inputfile: name of file giving impedance (BROAD BAND=0)
zxreal: column in INPUTFILE containing real impedance for x plane
zximag: column in INPUTFILE containing imaginary impedance for x plane
zyreal: column in INPUTFILE containing real impedance for y plane
zyimag: column in INPUTFILE containing imaginary impedance for y plane
bin_size: bin size for current histogram (use 0 for autosize)
n_bins: number of bins for current histogram
max_n_bins: Maximum number of bins for current histogram
smoothing: Use Savitzky-Golay filter to smooth current histogram?
factor: Factor by which to multiply x and y impedances.
xfactor: Factor by which to multiply x impedance.
yfactor: Factor by which to multiply y impedance.
wake_interval: interval in passes at which to output wake
wake_start: pass at which to start to output wake
wake_end: pass at which to stop to output wake
start_on_pass: The pass on which the impedance effects start.
ramp_passes: Number of passes over which to linearly ramp up the impedance to full strength.
high_frequency_cutoff0: Frequency at which smoothing filter begins. If not positive, no frequency filter smoothing is done. Frequency is in units of Nyquist (0.5/binsize).
high_frequency_cutoff1: Frequency at which smoothing filter is 0. If not given, defaults to HIGH FREQUENCY CUTOFF
x_drive_exponent: Exponent applied to x coordinates of drive particles
y_drive_exponent: Exponent applied to y coordinates of drive particles
x_probe_exponent: Exponent applied to x coordinates of probe particles
y_probe_exponent: Exponent applied to y coordinates of probe particles
bunched_beam_mode: If non-zero, then do calculations bunch-by-bunch.
group: Optionally used to assign an element to a group, with a user-defined name. Group names will appear in the parameter output file in the column ElementGroup

ALPH.title: ALPH
ALPH.description: An alpha magnet implemented as a matrix, up to 3rd order. PART is used to split the magnet into halves. XS<n>and DP<n>allow momentum filtration at the midpoint.

BMAPXY.title: BMAPXY
BMAPXY.description: A map of Bx and By vs x and y.

BUMPER.title: BUMPER
BUMPER.description: A time-dependent kicker magnet with optional spatial dependence of the kick and no fringe effects. The waveform is in SDDS format, with time in seconds and amplitude normalized to 1. The optional spatial dependence is also specified as an SDDS file.

CENTER.title: CENTER
CENTER.description: An element that centers the beam transversely on the ideal trajectory.

CEPL.title: CEPL
CEPL.description: A numerically-integrated linearly-ramped electric field deflector.

CHARGE.title: CHARGE
CHARGE.description: An element to establish the total charge of a beam. Active on first pass only. If given,overrides all charge specifications on other elements.

CLEAN.title: CLEAN
CLEAN.description: Cleans the beam by removing outlier particles.

CORGPIPE.title: CORGPIPE
CORGPIPE.description: A corrugated round pipe, commonly used as a dechirper in linacs.

CSBEND.title: CSBEND
CSBEND.description: A canonical kick sector dipole magnet.

CSRCSBEND.title: CSRCSBEND
CSRCSBEND.description: Like CSBEND, but incorporates a simulation of Coherent Synchrotron radiation.

CSRDRIFT.title: CSRDRIFT
CSRDRIFT.description: A follow-on element for CSRCSBEND that applies the CSR wake over a drift.

CWIGGLER.title: CWIGGLER
CWIGGLER.description: Tracks through a wiggler using canonical integration routines of Y.Wu (Duke University).

DRIF.title: DRIF
DRIF.description: A drift space implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order

DSCATTER.title: DSCATTER
DSCATTER.description: A scattering element to add random changes to particle coordinates according to a user-supplied distribution function

EDRIFT.title: EDRIFT
EDRIFT.description: Tracks through adrift with no approximations (Exact DRIFT).

EHKICK.title: EHKICK
EHKICK.description: A horizontal steering dipole implemented using an exact hard-edge model

EKICKER.title: EKICKER
EKICKER.description: A combined horizontal/vertical steering dipole implemented using an exact hard-edge model

EMATRIX.title: EMATRIX
EMATRIX.description: Explicit matrix input with data in the element definition, rather than in a file.

EMITTANCE.title: EMITTANCE
EMITTANCE.description: Applies a linear transformation to the beam to force the emittance to given values.

ENERGY.title: ENERGY
ENERGY.description: An element that matches the central momentum to the beam momentum, or changes the central momentum or energy to a specified value.

EVKICK.title: EVKICK
EVKICK.description: A vertical steering dipole implemented using an exact hard-edge model

FMULT.title: FMULT
FMULT.description: Multipole kick element with coefficient input from an SDDS file.

FRFMODE.title: FRFMODE
FRFMODE.description: One or more beam-driven TM monopole modes of an RF cavity, with data from a file.

FTABLE.title: FTABLE
FTABLE.description: Tracks through a magnetic field which is expressed by a SDDS table.

FTRFMODE.title: FTRFMODE
FTRFMODE.description: One or more beam-driven TM dipole modes of an RF cavity, with data from a file.

GFWIGGLER.title: GFWIGGLER
GFWIGGLER.description: Tracks through a wiggler using generate function method of J.Bahrdt and G. Wuestefeld (BESSY, Berlin, Germany).

HISTOGRAM.title: HISTOGRAM
HISTOGRAM.description: Request for histograms of particle coordinates to be output to SDDS file.

HKICK.title: HKICK
HKICK.description: A horizontal steering dipole implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

HMON.title: HMON
HMON.description: A horizontal position monitor, accepting a rpn equation for the readout as a function of the actual position (x).

ILMATRIX.title: ILMATRIX
ILMATRIX.description: An Individualized Linear Matrix for each particle for fast symplectic tracking with chromatic and amplitude-dependent effects

KICKER.title: KICKER
KICKER.description: A combined horizontal-vertical steering magnet implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order. For time-dependent kickers, see BUMPER.

KPOLY.title: KPOLY
KPOLY.description: A thin kick element with polynomial dependence on the coordinates in one plane.

KQUAD.title: KQUAD
KQUAD.description: A canonical kick quadrupole, which differs from the MULT element with ORDER=1 in that it can be used for tune correction.

KQUSE.title: KQUSE
KQUSE.description: A canonical kick element combining quadrupole and sextupole fields.

KSBEND.title: KSBEND
KSBEND.description: A kick bending magnet which is NOT canonical, but is better than a 2nd order matrix implementation. Recommend using CSBEND instead.

KSEXT.title: KSEXT
KSEXT.description: A canonical kick sextupole, which differs from the MULT element with ORDER=2 in that it can be used for chromaticity correction.

LRWAKE.title: LRWAKE
LRWAKE.description: Long-range (inter-bunch and inter-turn) longitudinal and transverse wake

LSRMDLTR.title: LSRMDLTR
LSRMDLTR.description: A non-symplectic numerically integrated planar undulator including optional co-propagating laser beam for laser modulation of the electron beam.

LTHINLENS.title: LTHINLENS
LTHINLENS.description: A thin lens for light optics

MAGNIFY.title: MAGNIFY
MAGNIFY.description: An element that allows multiplication of phase-space coordinates of all particles by constants.

MALIGN.title: MALIGN
MALIGN.description: A misalignment of the beam, implemented as a zero-order matrix.

MAPSOLENOID.title: MAPSOLENOID
MAPSOLENOID.description: A numerically-integrated solenoid specified as a map of (Bz,Br) vs (z, r).

MARK.title: MARK
MARK.description: A marker, equivalent to a zero-length drift space.

MATR.title: MATR
MATR.description: Explicit matrix input from a text file, in the format written by the print matrix command.

MATTER.title: MATTER
MATTER.description: A Coulomb-scattering and energy-absorbing element simulating material in the beam path.

MAXAMP.title: MAXAMP
MAXAMP.description: A collimating element that sets the maximum transmitted particle amplitudes for all following elements, until the next MAXAMP.

MBUMPER.title: MBUMPER
MBUMPER.description: A time-dependent multipole kicker magnet. The waveform is in SDDS format, with time in seconds and amplitude normalized to 1.

MHISTOGRAM.title: MHISTOGRAM
MHISTOGRAM.description: Request for multiple dimensions (1, 2, 4 or 6) histogram output of particle coordinates.

MODRF.title: MODRF
MODRF.description: A first-order matrix RF cavity with exact phase dependence, plus optional amplitude and phase modulation.

MONI.title: MONI
MONI.description: A two-plane position monitor, accepting two rpn equations for the readouts as a function of the actual positions (x and y).

MRFDF.title: MRFDF
MRFDF.description: Zero-length Multipole RF DeFlector from dipole to decapole

NIBEND.title: NIBEND
NIBEND.description: A numerically-integrated dipole magnet with various extended-fringe-field models.

NISEPT.title: NISEPT
NISEPT.description: A numerically-integrated dipole magnet with a Cartesian gradient.

OCTU.title: OCTU
OCTU.description: An octupole implemented as a third-order matrix

PFILTER.title: PFILTER
PFILTER.description: An element for energy and momentum filtration.

QUAD.title: QUAD
QUAD.description: A quadrupole implemented as a matrix, up to 3rd order.

QUFRINGE.title: QUFRINGE
QUFRINGE.description: An element consisting of a linearly increasing or decreasing quadrupole field.

RAMPP.title: RAMPP
RAMPP.description: A momentum-ramping element that changes the central momentum according to an SDDS-format file of the momentum factor vs time in seconds.

RAMPRF.title: RAMPRF
RAMPRF.description: A voltage-, phase-, and/or frequency-ramped RF cavity, implemented like RFCA.

RBEN.title: RBEN
RBEN.description: A rectangular dipole, implemented as a SBEND with edge angles, up to 2nd order.

RECIRC.title: RECIRC
RECIRC.description: An element that defines the point to which particles recirculate in multi-pass tracking

REFLECT.title: REFLECT
REFLECT.description: Reflects the beam back on itself, which is useful for multiple beamline matching.

REMCOR.title: REMCOR
REMCOR.description: An element to remove correlations from the tracked beam to simulate certain types of correction.

RFCA.title: RFCA
RFCA.description: A first-order matrix RF cavity with exact phase dependence.

RFCW.title: RFCW
RFCW.description: A combination of RFCA, WAKE, TRWAKE, and LSCDRIFT.

RFDF.title: RFDF
RFDF.description: A simple traveling or standing wave deflecting RF cavity.

RFMODE.title: RFMODE
RFMODE.description: A simulation of a beam-driven TM monopole mode of an RF cavity.

RFTM110.title: RFTM110
RFTM110.description: Tracks through a TM110-mode (deflecting) rf cavity with all magneticand electric field components. NOT RECOMMENDEDâSee below.

RFTMEZ0.title: RFTMEZ0
RFTMEZ0.description: A TM-mode RF cavity specified by the on-axis Ez field.

RIMULT.title: RIMULT
RIMULT.description: Multiplies radiation integrals by a given factor. Use to compute emittance for collection of various types of cells.

RMDF.title: RMDF
RMDF.description: A linearly-ramped electric field deflector, using an approximate analytical solution FOR LOW ENERGY PARTICLES.

ROTATE.title: ROTATE
ROTATE.description: An element that rotates the beam about the longitudinal axis.

SAMPLE.title: SAMPLE
SAMPLE.description: An element that reduces the number of particles in the beam by intervaal-based or random sampling.

SBEN.title: SBEN
SBEN.description: A sector dipole implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

SCATTER.title: SCATTER
SCATTER.description: A scattering element to add gaussian random numbers to particle coordinates.

SCMULT.title: SCMULT
SCMULT.description: Tracks through a zero length multipole to simulate space charge effects

SCRAPER.title: SCRAPER
SCRAPER.description: A collimating element that sticks into the beam from one side only. The directions 0, 1, 2, and 3 are from +x, +y, -x, and -y, respectively.

SCRIPT.title: SCRIPT
SCRIPT.description: An element that allows transforming the beam using an external script.

SEXT.title: SEXT
SEXT.description: A sextupole implemented as a matrix, up to 3rd order

SOLE.title: SOLE
SOLE.description: A solenoid implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

SREFFECTS.title: SREFFECTS
SREFFECTS.description: Lumped simulation of synchrotron radiation effects (damping andquantum excitation) for rings.

STRAY.title: STRAY
STRAY.description: A stray field element with local and global components. Global components are defined relative to the initial beamline direction.

TFBDRIVER.title: TFBDRIVER
TFBDRIVER.description: Driver for a turn-by-turn feedback loop

TFBPICKUP.title: TFBPICKUP
TFBPICKUP.description: Pickup for a turn-by-turn feedback loop

TMCF.title: TMCF
TMCF.description: A numerically-integrated accelerating TM RF cavity with spatially-constant fields.

TRCOUNT.title: TRCOUNT
TRCOUNT.description: An element that defines the point from which transmission calculations are made.

TRFMODE.title: TRFMODE
TRFMODE.description: A simulation of a beam-driven TM dipole mode of an RF cavity.

TRWAKE.title: TRWAKE
TRWAKE.description: Transverse wake specified as a function of time lag behind the particle.

TSCATTER.title: TSCATTER
TSCATTER.description: An element to simulate Touschek scattering.

TUBEND.title: TUBEND
TUBEND.description: A special rectangular bend element for top-up backtracking.

TWLA.title: TWLA
TWLA.description: A numerically-integrated first-space-harmonic traveling-wave linear accelerator.

UKICKMAP.title: UKICKMAP
UKICKMAP.description: An undulator kick map (e.g., using data from RADIA).

VKICK.title: VKICK
VKICK.description: A vertical steering dipole implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

VMON.title: VMON
VMON.description: A vertical position monitor, accepting a rpn equation for the readout as a function of the actual position (y).

WAKE.title: WAKE
WAKE.description: Longitudinal wake specified as a function of time lag behind the particle.

WATCH.title: WATCH
WATCH.description: A beam property/motion monitor-allowed modes are centroid, parameter, coordinate, and fft.

WIGGLER.title: WIGGLER
WIGGLER.description: A wiggler or undulator for damping or excitation of the beam.

ZLONGIT.title: ZLONGIT
ZLONGIT.description: A simulation of a single-pass broad-band or functionally specified longitudinal impedance.

ZTRANSVERSE.title: ZTRANSVERSE
ZTRANSVERSE.description: A simulation of a single-pass broad-band or functionally-specified transverse impedance.
